bytebase.store.Position.schema.json.description:
Handling unknown positions:
 - If the entire position is unknown, leave this field as nil/undefined
 - If only line is known, set line and leave column as 0 (e.g., line=5, column=0)
 - If only column is known (rare), set column and leave line as 0
 Frontends should check for nil/undefined/zero values and handle them appropriately.

column.description:
Examples:
 - "SELECT * FROM t" - column 8 is '*'
 - "SELECT ä½ å¥½ FROM t" - column 8 is 'ä½ ' (even though it's at byte offset 7)
 - "SELECT ðŸ˜€ FROM t" - column 8 is 'ðŸ˜€' (even though it's 4 bytes in UTF-8)
column.title:
Column position in a text (one-based).
 Column is measured in Unicode code points (characters/runes), not bytes or grapheme clusters.
 First character of the line is column 1.
 A value of 0 indicates the column information is unknown.

line.description:
Line position in a text (one-based).
 First line of the text is line 1.
 A value of 0 indicates the line information is unknown.

bytebase.store.Position.schema.json.title:
Position in a text expressed as one-based line and one-based column.
 We use 1-based numbering to match the majority of industry standards:
 - Monaco Editor uses 1-based (https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/typedoc/interfaces/IPosition.html)
 - GitHub Actions uses 1-based (https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/workflow-commands-for-github-actions#setting-an-error-message)
 - Most text editors display 1-based positions to users
 Note: LSP uses 0-based (https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#position),
 but we follow the canonical user-facing standards.

database.description:
The database containing the table.
 Format: instances/{instance}/databases/{database}

schema.description: Schema name (for databases that support schemas).

bytebase.store.PriorBackupDetail.Item.sc.description: Item represents a single backup operation for a table.

^(endPosition)$.description: Ending position in SQL for this backup operation.

^(sourceTable)$.description: The original table that was backed up.

^(startPosition)$.description: Starting position in SQL for this backup operation.

^(targetTable)$.description: The backup table where data was copied.

end_position.description: Ending position in SQL for this backup operation.

source_table.description: The original table that was backed up.

start_position.description: Starting position in SQL for this backup operation.

target_table.description: The backup table where data was copied.

bytebase.store.PriorBackupDetail.Item.sc.title: Item

bytebase.store.PriorBackupDetail.schema..description: PriorBackupDetail contains information about automatic backups created before migration.
bytebase.store.PriorBackupDetail.schema..title: Prior Backup Detail

bytebase.store.TaskRunResult.schema.json.description: TaskRunResult contains the outcome and metadata from a task run execution.

^(endPosition)$.description: Ending position in the SQL statement where an error occurred.

^(exportArchiveUid)$.description: UID of the export archive generated for export tasks.

^(priorBackupDetail)$.description: Backup details that can be used to rollback changes.

^(startPosition)$.description: Starting position in the SQL statement where an error occurred.

changelog.description:
Resource name of the changelog entry created by this run.
 Format: instances/{instance}/databases/{database}/changelogs/{changelog}

detail.description: Detailed execution information or error message.

end_position.description: Ending position in the SQL statement where an error occurred.

export_archive_uid.description: UID of the export archive generated for export tasks.

prior_backup_detail.description: Backup details that can be used to rollback changes.

start_position.description: Starting position in the SQL statement where an error occurred.

version.description: Schema version after the migration was applied.

bytebase.store.TaskRunResult.schema.json.title: Task Run Result
